title: Seismologist Julian Lozos quaking in the news!
content:
Check out the link or your west cost newspaper for the article and photo of my son Julian:

[http://news.yahoo.com/nphotos/computer-hard-drive-Javanese-Gamelan-music...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205034521/http:/news.yahoo.com/nphotos/computer-hard-drive-Javanese-Gamelan-music-instrument-Apple-MacBook/photo/080925/480/90cf015a2345416da93b6cad683d9b8d/s:/ap/20080925/ap_on_sc/sci_quake_trackers;_ylt=AjdXW0qE_XytHGbeDPk00apxieAA "http://news.yahoo.com/nphotos/computer-hard-drive-Javanese-Gamelan-music-instrument-Apple-MacBook/photo//080925/480/90cf015a2345416da93b6cad683d9b8d//s:/ap/20080925/ap\_on\_sc/sci\_quake\_trackers;\_ylt=AjdXW0qE\_XytHGbeDPk00apxieAA")

ChrisL
author: dezcom

comments.content:
Awesome Chris... makes you proud doesn’t it.

Michael

Thanks, Bob! The multiple geekdom effect is awsome. Julian has a home seismograph on a Mac laptop sitting in front of his Balanese Gamalan instrument! Julian just finished a Masters degree in Music Composition and now is working on a Masters to PhD in GeoPhysics with a specialty in earthquake science—bang the gong then crack up or whatever shakes you :-)

ChrisL

Is he going to be a seismologist when he graduates?

Michael

I am not sure, but something involving predictions of earthquake effects from seismic data. It is well beyond my technical expertise. It will be a GeoPhysics major but the career path beyond that has several possibilities.

ChrisL
Cool! Best Wishes to your son.
Well done, daddy! I don’t have funny pictures this time :)

Well how about this one of my daughter in ’87, star struck by your son Julian’s sure to come accomplishments? She sees the future! Just not seismic events.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205034521im_/http:/typophile.com/files/jen_6462.png)

Michael

She is quite a cuty:-) Give her a big hug!

ChrisL
I wish him all the best for his future; I’m sure he will make you feel a proud father, again.
That’s great, Chris! Julian looks like a true scientist.

Thanks Satya and Mili!

Julian just informed me of my typo. When I wrote “Balanese” I should have said “Javanese”. Se how flaky parents can be in their old age :-)

ChrisL
